In this case, the hyperprolactinemia is a side effect of the neuroleptic medication.
2. The second disease entity is "amenorrhea / galactorrhea." Amenorrhea is a condition in which a woman of reproductive age fails to have menstrual periods. Galactorrhea is a condition in which a woman produces milk from her breasts when she is not pregnant or breastfeeding. These two conditions can be related to high levels of prolactin in the blood.

Therefore, the disease entities in the paragraph are "neuroleptic-associated hyperprolactinemia," "amenorrhea," and "galactorrhea."

* amenorrhea / galactorrhea: These are medical conditions related to the menstrual cycle and lactation, respectively. Amenorrhea is the absence of menstruation, while galactorrhea is the spontaneous flow of milk from the breast. They are not chemical entities but potential side effects of elevated prolactin levels.
